subject: Investing
title: Competitive Moats and Lasting Dividends
description: Learn Competitive Moats and Lasting Dividends in one minute.

hook.text: Coca-Cola has paid rising dividends for 60+ years. Its moat? A brand recognized by 94% of the world's population.

buildup.text: A competitive moat is a durable advantage that protects a company's profits from competitors.

discovery.text: Moats come from brands, patents, network effects, switching costs, or cost advantagesâ€”all shield cash flows.

twist.text: Without a moat, high profits attract competitors who erode marginsâ€”and eventually the dividend gets cut.

climax.text: The best dividend stocks combine a wide moat with a reasonable payout ratio and growing free cash flow.

punchline.text: Moats protect profits. Protected profits protect your dividends.

quiz.question: Why are competitive moats important for dividend investors?
options: They protect the profits that fund sustainable dividends
